title: Glucosamine prevents cell mediated cytotoxicity of natural killer cell line NK-92

author: Janja Božič, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: Hello everybody, so I'm going to present you how glucosamine disarms natural killer cells.
So first, what is glucosamine?
Glucosamine is monosaccharide that is naturally present in our joints, but is very extensively used for.
A food supplement for management of the pain in Austria arthritis.

And these are mostly used the people over the 50, and because people over 50 are also more sensible for other diseases, isn't it is very important that we study effective glucosamine also on other things in the body.
One of them is.
Immune system and one part of the immune system are natural killer cells.
So natural killer cells are subset of immune cells that are born to kill and our first response to virus infected and tumor cells.
And how does they kill the target cells?
So first they recognize the target cell.
Then sorry.
Bend the cells comes to the contact and lytic granulous or cytotoxic Randall is the natural killer.
Cells have come to the contact of the target and natural killer cell after this.
This cytotoxic granules are released into the target cells and this cytotoxic grinder is killed.
The target cells and what's the function of glucosamine in this story?
So glucosamine decreases cytotoxic activity of natural killer cells and it does like this.
So this is normal state when this lytic panels are in contact with target cells and when we have the glucosamine.
Um, this.
Lytic granulous all all around the cells.
And because of that, natural killer cells cannot kill the target cell and these are pictures from microscope which are confirming our theory of distribution of this lytic granulous.
How does glucosamine does that?
Please visit my poster.
And I will talk about it more detail.
So it is important also that I tell you that this is just on cells.
It's not made in vivo and because of that we cannot yet say if glucosamine is good or bad to take.
OK, thank you for all the people that work with me and thank you.
